alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued January 16 at 12:14PM EST until January 17 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 4 AM EST Monday, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 3.5 feet, water covers roads on Saint George Island, is in yards, and is approaching structures. To the east, inundation is occurring at multiple marinas off St. Mary`s River, Smith Creek, and Jutland Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides two and a half to three feet above normal. The next high tide at Point Lookout is at |12:46 PM and 12:26 AM. The next high tide at Piney Point is at 1:21 PM and 1:53 AM. The next high tide at Coltons Point is at 1:57 PM and 2:29 AM. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. St Marys River at Straits Point MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 1.9 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 15/11 PM 1.8 0.2 0.9 0 None 16/01 PM 2.3 0.7 1.0 1 None 17/12 AM 3.6 2.0 2.7 2-3 Moderate 17/11 AM 2.3 0.7 1.5 3 None 17/10 PM 0.5 -1.1 0.2 2 None 18/01 PM 0.2 -1.4 -1.0 1-2 None &&
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
